page.title: 12The Bittell Reservoirs
page.content: There are{two reservoirs}named the Lower Bittell and provide some interesting local history. Lower Bittell reservoir was made in 1815 to ensure the supply of water-power to{mills}on the river Arrow which powered the Redditch needle mills among others. It was important to{industry. }Nowadays it is used as a private{fishing club. The Upper Bittell reservoir was made in 1833 to provide reserce supply for the canal. It is mentioned as a Fishing Club in the sale catalogue of 1889 when land for housing was first offered by the Hewell Estates (Windsors). It is important now for {recreation. } There is fishing, sailing and wind-surfing taking place on it.
